title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions of Eterna Therapeutics Inc

content.text: Eterna Therapeutics Inc goes public and lists on the stock exchange.
Eterna Therapeutics Inc announces a 2-for-1 stock split, increasing the number of shares available to shareholders.
Eterna Therapeutics Inc acquires a competitor company, expanding its product portfolio and market presence.
Eterna Therapeutics Inc undergoes a reverse stock split of 1-for-10, reducing the number of outstanding shares but increasing the price per share.
Eterna Therapeutics Inc announces a dividend distribution to shareholders, providing them with additional earnings.
Eterna Therapeutics Inc conducts a secondary offering, issuing new shares to raise additional capital for business expansion.
Eterna Therapeutics Inc merges with a larger pharmaceutical company, resulting in a change in the corporate structure and leadership.
Eterna Therapeutics Inc continues to operate as a subsidiary of the acquiring company, focusing on research and development of innovative therapeutic solutions.
